title: Challenge 1 · Self vs. Others Reflection Tool
summary: Help participants notice whether they naturally lead from a self-first or others-first orientation before the AI Coach mirrors it back.
instructions: Rate yourself on each statement from 1 (Strongly Disagree) to 5 (Strongly Agree).
Each pair of prompts contrasts a Self-in lens with an Others-in lens. Encourage the participant to choose instinctively.
After rating both prompts in a pair, highlight which side received the higher score. That selection counts toward the final orientation score.
Once all five sections are complete, total the number of higher scores across the Self-in prompts (questions 1, 3, 5, 7, 9) and the Others-in prompts (questions 2, 4, 6, 8, 10).

scale.displayHint: Use a Likert slider or radio group so the participant can see all five anchors.

prompts.statement: I see leadership as a platform to make things happen using my judgment and ideas.
I feel responsible for using my role to elevate others and serve the larger system.
I often focus on aligning others to my vision or way of working.
I invest time in understanding what others value and care about.
I expect others to adapt to my leadership style for clarity and speed.
I consciously shift my approach based on the needs and working styles of others.
I see my role as a decision-maker who guides and directs.
I see my role as a collaborator who facilitates and learns with others.
My growth as a leader is mostly about knowing and expressing my true self.
My growth as a leader is about expanding my ability to serve diverse needs.

steps: Within each section, compare the ratings for the Self-in and Others-in prompt.
Whichever prompt has the higher rating earns one point for that orientation. Ties can be treated as "balanced" for that pair.
Sum all Self-in wins (questions 1, 3, 5, 7, 9) and all Others-in wins (questions 2, 4, 6, 8, 10).

insightBands.label: Mostly Self-in
insightBands.summary: You lead from a strong sense of self—your beliefs, identity, and vision are your compass. You may benefit from developing greater empathy and adaptive capacity.

insightBands.label: Balanced
insightBands.summary: You are integrating both styles—aware of self, yet increasingly tuned into others. This is a dynamic, reflective zone of growth.

insightBands.label: Mostly Others-in
insightBands.summary: You lead from service—others’ needs and values shape your choices. You may benefit from anchoring more in self when clarity or assertiveness is needed.

scoring.tieHandling: If both orientations have the same count, default to the Balanced narrative.

reflectionPrompts: Where did your instincts pull you toward a Self-in choice? What was happening for you in that situation?
Where did you clearly prioritise others? How does that show up inside your current team?

conceptPanel.caption: Self vs. Others in Leadership framework
conceptPanel.highlightStrategy: Show a marker on the continuum that corresponds to the final band.
